description: Speed up your application with Caching strategies

slides.title: Why Cache?
slides.content:
# The Need for Speed ‚ö°

Generating dynamic pages is expensive (DB queries, template rendering). Caching saves the result of these expensive operations so future requests are instant.

## Backend Types
- **Memcached**: Pure memory, fastest.
- **Redis**: Fast, persistent, advanced data types.
- **Database**: Stores cache in SQL table.
- **LocMem**: Local memory (good for dev).
- **Dummy**: No caching (good for dev).

slides.title: Per-Site & Per-View
slides.content:
# Caching Strategies üìê

## Per-Site Cache
Cache the entire website. Add `UpdateCacheMiddleware` (first) and `FetchFromCacheMiddleware` (last) to settings.

## Per-View Cache
Most common. Cache specific views.
```django
from django.views.decorators.cache import cache_page

@cache_page(60 * 15) # Cache for 15 minutes
def my_view(request):
    ...
```

slides.title: Template Fragment Caching
slides.content:
# Fragment Caching üß© If only part of a page is expensive (e.g., a sidebar with complex stats), cache just that part in the template! ```html {% load cache %} {% cache 500 sidebar %}
...
{% endcache %} ```
